fields.description:
h3. Summary

Incorrect attachment URL received via email after editing a page.


h3. Steps to replicate

 # Turn on 'Notify on my actions' in Settings
 # Create a new page that includes an attachment link in the body, publish it.
 # Check your e-mail and you should see a create page notification. The link in this initial notification should be the full link and function as expected.
 # Edit the page and add some text at the bottom of the page, publish the change.
 # Check e-mail again

h3. Observed Behavior

The URL of the attachment link in the notification will be incorrect. It will just be the base URL with a '#' character appended such as [https://attachtest.atlassian.net/wiki#|https://attachtest.atlassian.net/wiki]

h3. Expected Behavior

The correct URL for the attachment link in the email notification.
fields.summary: URL of the attachment link in edit notification is incorrect

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In Confluence, if the user uses the *Insert Link > Files* option in order to attach a new (large, around 100MB) file and create a link for the same, the same will not be uploaded.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In Confluence, go to any page and tap the *link* option in the editor menu
# Once the link pop-up is open, make sure to select the *Files* option
# Upload a large file (80MB+)

h3. Expected Results
The file should be uploaded and provide the user an option to link the same.

h3. Actual Results
The file is not uploaded. Sometimes, no message is displayed. Other times, the following is displayed in the attachment dialog:
"Cannot upload the file to Confluence. The server may not be available this time" 

h3.Workaround
Upload the file from the *Insert* menu in the editor, and then, manually create a link for the same
fields.summary: Uploading larger files from "Link" dialog fails

fields.description:
h3. Summary

While inserting the [Jira issues macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/jira-issues-macro-724765217.html] as a *table*, including the *Resolved* field, if the case is resolved in the latest days of the *previous month*, Confluence will display the *Resolved* field with one day ahead of the current one.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In Jira, make sure that you have an issue resolved in the latest(s) day(s) of the month (for example, October 31st)
# Create a Page in Confluence and include the *Jira issues macro* with a filter to include the resolved date, or, simply add the issue in *table* mode, as long as it has the *Resolved* field added to the display options.
# Publish the page

h3. Expected Results
The date of the Jira issues macro should be the same as Jira

h3. Actual Results
Confluence displays the result with one day ahead.
 
h3. Notes

* This has been only observed for specific months/days.
* Screenshots of the issue in Jira and in Confluence:

!jira.png|thumbnail!
!confluence.png|thumbnail!


h3.Workaround
No workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Erroneous "Resolved Date" for Jira Issues macro

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Anonymous users who try to access a Confluence page that they don't have access to, are getting a blank page instead of a login screen. It seems that it's intermittently happening.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Enable Anonymous Access in Global Permission
# Create a space and enable Anonymous Access
# Create a page and add a page restriction where anonymous should not have access to the page.
# Anonymous user tries to access the direct link of the page that was created in Step 3 

h3. Expected Results
* Anonymous users should be redirected to a login screen when they accessed restricted content 

h3. Actual Results
* Anonymous users are getting a blank page when they accessed restricted content
fields.summary: Anonymous users not redirected to a login screen when they accessed restricted content

fields.description: We would like to see that the 'Excerp Include' macro can  display an Link to the included Page. Now we can only display the title of the included page.
fields.summary: Excerp Include: include a link to the included Page

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Similar to [CONFCLOUD-61672|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-61672], when trying to upload larger attachments (tested with 50MB or more) through the *attachments* option for each page, the following message will be displayed:
"*Your request could not be processed because a required security token was not present in the request. You may need to re-submit the form to reload the page*"

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In Confluence, go to any page and tap the *ellipsis button (...) > Attachments*
# There, make sure to upload a 200MB+ attachments

h3. Expected Results
After a while, the attachment should be properly uploaded.

h3. Actual Results
The attachment is not uploaded and the user will be prompted with the message:  

!attachment.png|thumbnail!

h3. Notes
It happens intermittently, but, more for negative results (not being able to upload the same).

h3.Workaround
Use the option to upload files from the *edit* mode of the page: 

# Tap the *edit* button
# On the editor's menu, tap the *'+/insert' button > Files and Images*
# Upload the attachment

Drag and drop the file into the page while published also helps, as it will use a different method to do the upload.
fields.summary: Larger attachments having intermittent issues to be uploaded

fields.description:
h3. Summary
JIRA Gadgets Do not load when visiting a page with that Macro.
The Macro instead gives the following error: 
{noformat}
This gadget cannot be displayed on your dashboard. This could be due to a licensing problem or an application error. If you need this gadget, contact your administrator for assistance. Otherwise, you can remove it from your dashboard.
{noformat}

h3. Environment
(Optional - If Applicable)
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a sprint burndown Gadget to a page, Other JIRA gadgets that gather data on multiple issues will also work.
# view the page with the gadget after a good amount of time has passed.

h3. Expected Results

The Gadget Loads with no issues.

h3. Actual Results
The Gadget Does not load and you get the error as stated above.
 
h3. Notes
* Refreshing the page will load the gadget.
* When facing issues to load the gadget, the same will not be displayed on the macro browser as well.

h3.Workaround
Reload the page to view the gadget.
fields.summary: JIRA Gadget macros fail to load

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In Confluence, if the user creates a space with "*welcome* " as the space key, when trying to access links for the pages in the space (e.g. directly from external sources, copying and pasting or shortcuts/bookmarks), Confluence will redirect the user to the Dashboard. 
 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to Confluence and create a new space (either by going to the space directory or tapping the *Create Space* button in the dashboard)
# Make sure that the *space key* will be "welcome" and create it
# Copy the link for any page in this space (this can also include the 'Overview' page) and paste in your browser to access again, or, save this link in an external source/send to a colleague.

h3. Expected Results
The page should properly load.

h3. Actual Results
The user is redirected to Confluence's dashboard if already went through the onboarding process.
 
h3. Notes
* If the user did not go through the "welcome" process, the same will be prompted with the onboarding of Confluence. Even if navigating in Confluence/using the search to find the page.
* This does not happen if you navigate to the pages while in Confluence (e.g. using the search, "all activities" tab or shortcuts). It only happens if you tap the page's link outside of Confluence, or if you try to access the space through the *Space Directory*/Full search of Confluence.
* Recorded a quick video with examples

h3.Workaround
No workaround unless using a different space key.
fields.summary: "Welcome" space key does not work properly in Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When trying to add an attachment through file picker option, it fails with error: Your request could not be processed because a required security token was not present in the request. You may need to re-submit the form or reload the page.

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud 


h3. Steps to Reproduce
Step 1 Create a page in Confluence, Click on (...) on the top right corner of the page then click on Attachment.
Step 2 Click on Choose File, select the file to upload(which can take more than 2 minutes to upload), then click on Attach

h3. Expected Results
File should get uploaded.

h3. Actual Results
File upload fails with error: Your request could not be processed because a required security token was not present in the request. You may need to re-submit the form or reload the page.

h3. Workaround
Drag and drop the file.
fields.summary: Uploading a file fails when attaching through file picker option and the time for upload is more than 2 minutes

fields.description:
Page labels have higher z-index than an inline comment. As a result they are being rendered over the comment, with surprising results - you can get a label inside an input field for a new comment. See the attached screen shot.

It's a bit flaky. Usually page height is extended so that labels are rendered under the last comment. Sometimes labels just jump up on their own - I suspect that some page elements are being lazy-loaded. If not, try making some action on the page, e.g. reply to a comment under a page, click like, scroll page to the right to bounce it etc. It looks like it sometimes rearranges elements on the page or modifies page width which results in this behaviour.

I'm not sure if slowing down network speed could help in reproducing this.

Page for tests:

https://hello.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/~mparfianowicz/pages/326883478/Test
fields.summary: Page labels have higher z-index than an inline comment

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Office Excel macro is not rendering attached .xls file correctly. Behaves better if scrolled down very slowly but still shows gaps and often loading (keep spinning) on the published page. When scrolled down quickly, doesn't render anything. Moving the scroller up/down renders the xls file content but they often disappear when scroller is stationary.
h3. Environment

Confluence 1000.0.0-3667ef1ac6b
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Edit a page and attach an Excel file with enough lines to scroller to show
 # Insert Office Excel Macro
 # Publish the page
 # Try to scroll down the in the macro display area

h3. Expected Results

The macro should render the attached .xls file / chart/graph without gaps and smoothly.
h3. Actual Results

Macro renders the file inconsistently with gaps, spinning wheel showing. Behaves better when scroller is moving real slow.
h3. Workaround

Try "hard refreshing" the page with CTRL + F5 (Windows) or CMD + Shift + R (Mac).
h3. Note

This was tested in Chrome (Mac OS High Sierra 10.13.6) Version 70.0.3538.67 (Official Build) (64-bit)
fields.summary: Office Excel macro not rendering correctly

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The Project Plans index page is not listing the created Project Plans pages.
h3. Environment
 * Confluence Cloud.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new page using the "Project Plan" template
 # It will automatically create the "Project Plans" index page.

h3. Expected Results

The "Project Plans" index page should list all existing Project Plans pages
h3. Actual Results

It doesn't list the existing pages.
h3. Workaround

fields.summary: The Project Plans index page is not listing the existing Project Plans pages

fields.description:
When a view restriction is applied on a regular page, the page's child pages inherit the view restriction.

It would be great to have the ability to add page restrictions at the top level blog posts in Confluence just like it is possible for regular pages.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In Confluence, when using the [Profile Picture macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/profile-picture-macro-724765268.html] inside a [Page Properties macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/page-properties-macro-724765240.html] to create a report in a [Page Properties Report|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/page-properties-report-macro-724765250.html] for an *Overview page of a space*, depending on the number of logos to be retrieved, the popup with the user information will not be displayed.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In Confluence, create a page (or multiple pages in order to achieve a higher number of avatars) and insert a Page Properties macro
# Insert multiple Profile Picture macros for different users
# Save the page with the appropriated label to have it to be retrieved in the overview page of the space later
# Now, in the *Overview page* only, insert a *Page properties Report* macro to retrieve the content created previously
# Publish the page and hover the cursor over one of the inserted pictures

h3. Expected Results
The popup with the user information should be displayed
h3. Actual Results
No content will be displayed upon hovering the cursor 

h3. Notes
* If the Page Properties report macro is inserted on a non-overview page of the space, it will take around 20-30 seconds to have the popup back.
* This only happens after adding a good amount of pictures in the macro, meaning that this seems to be related to how many pictures are being inserted
* Tested with a simple page with multiple Profile Picture macros inserted to check if only the pictures were the cause. Could not reproduce the issue.

h3.Workaround
* If the user manually highlights any text on the page (so the popup for Inline comments / Add Jira issues macro will be displayed), the popup for the pictures will be immediately displayed
* Remove a few pictures from the original page(s) until Confluence properly triggers the popup
* Put the Page Properties Report content on a child page and expect around 30 seconds to have the popups back
fields.summary: Profile Picture macro not working properly within Page Properties Report

fields.description:
Hello,

 

We have Confluence spaces that we were finally able to share with our clients, but because of licensing limitations, we're only able to do so through Service Desk (by linking the Confluence space to Service Desk and providing the client access to SD), which only gives them read/view access to Confluence.

We'd love to be able to collaborate with the client on the same Confluence space and allow our clients to interact with the pages as well (edit, create, etc.).

In previous contact with one of your support members, she informed me that Atlassian required another license to be purchased for each of my clients so they can access Confluence. 

The problem with this approach is that my company already pays for Confluence licenses. My clients all also pay for Confluence licenses for their users, so requiring another license to be bought for the same users so that they can use Confluence is not a fair deal in my opinion.

I would've agreed if they didn't have Confluence licenses, but in fact they do. Atlassian only has to open that door to collaboration which would bring so many benefits for its clients.

Thanks for considering my suggestion.

 

Sincerely,

Ricardo
fields.summary: Cross-enterprise users to be able to collaborate on Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Some operations, such as archiving a space, trigger a license count that is defined in Confluence. The in-application license calculation can prevent these operations from completing even when there are free licenses if some of those licenses are granted back by disabling an Account in Atlassian Access Admin hub.

h3. Environment
Confluence and Atlassian Access Admin hub.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# create an annual licensed instance and invite users to consume all the licenses ensuring that you can manage at least some of them from Atlassian Admin Hub.
# Disable some of those accounts from Admin Hub
# attempt to archive a space.

h3. Expected Results
The operation is completed.


h3. Actual Results
This error shows in the UI:
{noformat}
This Confluence installation is not licensed for additional users
You have exceeded the maximum number of users for your license. You will still be able to view content, but in order to create or edit content, you must reduce the number of active users in the installation.
There are two ways to reduce the number of active users:

- Disable users
- Delete users
To disable or delete a user, visit the Users page then search for their name. After following the appropriate link you can choose the 'Remove' or 'Disable' option.
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
This does not impact instances that use monthly billing.

h3. Workaround

fields.description:
Hi. Would it be possible to add _all_ changes to the Atlassian blog ([https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/blog]) or Developer blog (https://developer.atlassian.com/blog/)?

For example, we have a JSON blob that pulls Sprint information via 'customfield_10007.' The way it used to be sent if an issue was not associated with a Sprint is a pair of empty brackets. This method is still used when we query the Kanban issues for Sprint information. Atlassian has now changed the JSON to return “NULL” for that field instead, which broke the code.

Old way:

"customfield_10007":[]

 

New way:

"customfield_10007":null

 

I do not see that change mentioned in either blog. As an alternative, perhaps there is a centralized repository for release notes that one can "watch" and get notified whenever any type of release note is updated/added?
fields.summary: Change/Release Notes

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Even after disabling *Questions for Confluence*, the questions do appear in search results.
 If we click on the link it does errors out.
h3. Environment
 * Confluence cloud
 * Questions for Confluence add-on

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create any space in the instance
 # Enable *Questions for Confluence* add-on
 # Create Question's under that specific space.
 # Unsubscribe the add-on.
 # Try searching the instance with any keyword added in that questions.

h3. Expected Results

It shouldn't be appearing in the search results.
h3. Actual Results

It appears and accessing the link errors out which is expected.

h3. Work Around

To avoid seeing broken links to Confluence Questions content in advanced search results, unsubscribing is not enough. In addition to unsubscribing, site admin(s) must also *uninstall* Confluence Questions plugin. This will remove the broken links from search results and if users would like to reinstall the CQ plugin at a later time, their old content will still be available upon reinstallation.

h3. Notes

This is not observed for questions added to *CQ* space. Only the user's space is showing this behavior.
fields.summary: Disabled add-on questions still appears in search results

fields.description:
There are numerous discussions about this in the community, but I was unable to find an existing issue for it...

It is extremely common in customer support to want to publish customer-specific documentation. This may include specific contact info, server names/IP addresses, workflow diagrams, support guides, and more. I'm quite surprised that there is no way to do this using the Service Desk/Confluence integration. This seems like a critical piece of that integration. Without it, I'm stuck creating the documentation in another tool and attaching it to a service desk request. Which is very sad. It also won't allow them to search for it easily in the way that KB searches function.

*Possible Approaches:*
 * Allow Service Desk users and organizations to be selectable in the Restrictions of Confluence pages. (This seems like the simplest and easiest to implement to me.)
 * Allow linking multiple Confluence spaces to Service Desk, with ability to restrict certain spaces by Organization.
 * Others? Please suggest...

 

Related Community Discussions:
 * [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-Service-Desk-questions/Service-Desk-Customer-Portal-Customization-with-customer/qaq-p/697471]
 * [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Confluence-questions/Customer-specific-Knowledge-base/qaq-p/595217]
 * [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Marketplace-Apps-questions/Single-Service-Desk-Customer-specific-knowledge-base-s/qaq-p/630004]
 * [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Questions/Is-it-possible-to-creat-customer-specific-confluence-spaces/qaq-p/599889]
fields.summary: Customer-specific Confluence Pages in Service Desk

fields.description:
The customers have many pages which display the document content inline, e.g. through "View Excel", "View Word" or "View Powerpoint" macros.
In these cases, there is no way to get into the attachment previewer.
A workaround would be to add an "Edit" link to the page manually. Not user-friendly.
An additional request would be to add an "Edit" button to the View Files macros. Remember there are many users which have already expressed the request to not obsolete this macro!
Sites which have the lock-point plugin installed, to make sure that an attachment is not concurrently edited by several people (to address the "last upload wins" issue).
For such sites, this flow is being enforced at the moment:
* go to the attachment page
* lock the document
* go to view mode
* view the document in previewer -> Edit with ... 
* upload the change
* exit previewer
* go back to the attachment page
* unlock the document.
This requires to navigate between the attachment page and view page 2 times. Productivity loss. By adding the "Edit" link to the attachment page, this would not be necessary.
fields.summary: Add an Edit (or Preview) button to the View Files macro

fields.description:
Confluence version prior to 6.11 had the "Edit in Office" link in the attachment page.
This has been removed in 6.11 and later versions.
Although "Edit with" is now available in the attachment previewer, having an "Edit" link in the attachment list has still value for our Customers.
The customer would like to still be able to open an attachment in Edit mode without having to go to the View mode of the page.
This saves time, increases overall work efficiency and improves the application user experience.

Use Case (Customer feedback)
When reviewing the list of attachment, I determine which attachment to edit. Then I want to be able to edit it from this place. This is currently not possible. Instead, I have to click onto "View Page", find the link to the attachment in the page (which may be a long one!) and open the previewer from there. Loss of productivity!
fields.summary: Bring back the "Edit in Office" link to the attachment Page

fields.description:
h3. Summary

With the [introduction of the new editor|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/confluence-editing-improvements-945107733.html] for pages, when the user tries to retrieve an [Excerpt|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/excerpt-macro-724765191.html] with the [Excerpt Include macro |https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/excerpt-include-macro-724765190.html]from a page Created with the older editor (TinyMCE) that includes different sections, or where the Excerpt is wrapped in a table or macro, the inclusion will fail with an error.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page using the old editor and make sure to use the older model of sections, like the two even columns: !two.png|thumbnail! Alternatively, you can create a table or a macro in which you will include the Excerpt.
 # Add the *Excerpt* macro to this page and have some content inside the same
 # Publish this page
 # Now, use a page that already has the new editor (e.g. Meeting Notes and Blog posts)
 # Add the *Excerpt Include* macro and point it to the page created in the first step
 # Save the configuration and publish the page

h3. Expected Results

The "Excerpt Include" macro should properly retrieve the content from the page.
h3. Actual Results

The following message is displayed when using the macro:
{code:java}
Error loading excerpt from "Space Key:Test Page".{code}
!macro.png|thumbnail!
h3. Notes
 * The older section model does not need to be inside the excerpt to have the issue happening.
 * This seems to be happening because the new editor only allows a fixed centralized section for the pages and the same cannot be changed or have new ones included as the older one. Update: While columns have been added to the new Editing Experience, they behave differently than sections.
 * The following messages are displayed in the browser's console:
{code:java}
No excerpt found for SPACEKEY:Page name
{code}

 * While previewing the macro, the same displays properly:
 !look.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround

In the page that the excerpt will be retrieved, do not use sections, and make sure there is no wrapping around the excerpt.
fields.summary: Excerpt Include Macro Fails in Fabric, if the included excerpt is from TinyMCE and is in a section/table/macro

fields.description:
(related to I18n, Internationalization, Localization)

*Requirements*
 * Pages should be able to have multiple versions per language.
 * Search results should display the versions of articles in user's logged-in language. This should apply when using the search from the Service Desk portals as well.
 * When viewing a page, a user should see links to the different language versions (like Wikipedia does.)
 * The translated pages should know which language should be considered the "primary language". The primary language should have a Space-level default and be switchable per page.
 * When a user views a secondary language version, the page should display a warning indicating when the primary version has been updated more recently (i.e. "This page may no longer be current").
 * Admins should be able to see a list of pages which have either not yet been translated into a given locale (e.g. "How to Cook Tacos" is available in English but not Japanese) or have had updates to the primary version.
 * Provide API hooks when a translated page was updated, along with change list (e.g. to facilitate marketplace integration of translation services.)
 * Admins should be able to define locale fallbacks at the space-level, for example, "Simplified Chinese" falls back to "Traditional Chinese" if available, otherwise falls back to "English" (meaning that Chinese users will see English content if the Chinese version isn't available.)
 * Ideally, URLs for other language versions would use the same slug as the primary version, could be something like /my-blog-post?lang=en and /my-blog-post?lang=fr

Wikipedia should be considered a reference for this functionality. There is also a requirement doc from 2006 here [https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?spaceKey=DISC&title=Translation+of+content] which is still relevant.

*Current Workarounds*

Currently, the recommended solution is to make multiple Confluence Spaces, one for each language. This approach is fraught with problems, for example, since one Service Desk can only be linked to one Confluence space, you effectively can't use Service Desks in multiple languages with Confluence.

*Note about Marketplace*

The related tickets CONFCLOUD-1076 / CONFSERVER-1076 were closed 5 years ago with a note saying this would be handled by the marketplace, However, in 5 years the marketplace has not produced a tenable solution in either the cloud or server versions.
There are some translation management solutions such as Appfusions ([http://www.appfusions.com/display/LNGOTKC/Home]) however these are not substitute for the core issue here, which is that Confluence lacks the proper datastructure. If Atlassian makes the proper datastructure (described above) then it will facilitate more translation solutions (e.g. human, machine, etc) being made available on the marketplace, especially if API hooks are made when content changes.
fields.summary: Confluence: Support multiple page versions per language

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The issue is intermittent.
Breadcrumbs repeat parent space name. It does happen while accessing them manually or searching them.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Padlock (Lock) Icon to Set Page Restrictions Missing From Space Overview Home Page. Subsequently, when a user requests access to a restricted overview page, when the admin receives the request email and is redirected to the overview page, the popup prompt to Grant or Deny the request does not appear, possibly due to the fact that the icon does not exist.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Restrict View and Edit of a Space overview page.
# Login as a user without permissions to view the overview page, and navigate straight to the URL of the Overview page
# Click on the 'Request Access' button
# An email is fired and sent to the admin
# Admin checks the email, clicks on the 'Review Request' link
# Admin is redirected to the Overview page to review the request.

h3. Expected Behaviour
Admin should see a popup to either 'Grant' or 'Deny' the request.

h3. Actual behaviour
Admin does not receive a popup to process the request

h3. Workaround
Amend/edit the restrictions manually by hitting the '...' icon on the top right corner of the page and selecting restrictions

h3. Further notes
The padlock icon is available in the Edit mode of the overview page.
fields.summary: Padlock (Lock) Icon to Set Page Restrictions Missing From Space Overview Home Page

fields.description:
Confluence has a feature to upload new versions of an attachment. This works if the file has the same name, but not if you change the name of the file.

Eg. 

my file - v1.txt

my file - v2.txt

uploading the second file as a new version of the first file, should leave just one attachment, named "my file - v2.txt", with two versions. Even better if you could dictate the attachment file name to be different form the uploaded file. In this case "my file.txt" with versioning. When downloading v1 I would get a file named "my file - v1.txt"

 

The reason for this is that Windows file system does not support versioning, so the easiest way to keep track of which version you are working with, add a version number or a date to the file name.
fields.summary: Upload new version of an attachment with a different file name.

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

We have noticed that the copy > paste feature for images is not working all the time and we are ending up with a broken image error displayed after publishing the page.

(on) This bug only affects the old editor.
h3. *Steps to Reproduce*
 # Edit a Confluence page
 # Copy a image
 # Paste the image
 # Publish the page
 # Notice that instead of the image being displayed, there is an error message displayed

h3. *Expected Results*

The image should be displayed as expected after publishing the page
h3. *Actual Results*

The image it is not displayed and an error message Broken image is displayed:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
h3. *Notes*

This issue was noticed to be reproducible intermittently.
h3. *Workaround*

If you use the *Insert files and images* macro to upload the image, it will work properly.
 !image-2020-08-04-21-01-52-836.png|width=205,height=73!

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Previously, when the user inserted an [iFrame macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/iframe-macro-950276528.html] to display a Kanban Board/Backlog from a Jira Software Project, the same would display the issues and requests. By now, if inserting it, it only displays the Jira sidebar, allowing the user to see/interact with other options.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In Confluence, create/edit a page
# Tap the *Insert* button > *Other Macros* > Then, select the *iFrame* macro
# Insert a board from a Jira software project (URL should be something like 'https://example.atlassian.net/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=23')
# Save the macro configuration and publish the page

h3. Expected Results
The iFrame should render all the content from the Jira board, including the issues.
h3. Actual Results
Only the sidebar is displayed, as the example below:
!sidebar.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Notes
The following errors are displayed in the console when trying to view the iFrame's content:
{code}
Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'setNewIssueViewEnabled' of undefined
    at HTMLDocument.GH.RapidBoard.init (batch.js?adg3Enabled=true&agile_global_admin_condition=true&devsummary=true&globalSidebarEnabled=true&jag=true&jaguser=true&jira-nps-enabled=true&locale=en-US&nps-not-opted-out=true&sd_operational=true:5356)
    at j (batch.js?adg3Enabled=true&locale=en-US:76)
    at Object.fireWith (batch.js?adg3Enabled=true&locale=en-US:77)
    at Function.ready (batch.js?adg3Enabled=true&locale=en-US:65)
    at HTMLDocument.Q (batch.js?adg3Enabled=true&locale=en-US:75)
{code}

And

{code}
Uncaught (in promise) Unable to load bridge "internal/browser-metrics"
Promise.then (async)
(anonymous) @ index.js:53
{code}

h3.Workaround
There is no workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Kanban Board/Backlog not displaying in Confluence's iFrame macro

However, once the user tries to change it to a different one, a "*Page not Found*" message will be displayed:

(Optional - If Necessary)

fields.description:
It would be nice if I could create page "types" and have a different icon for each.  I would also like separate naming collision for each type. For instance, I could have a "fruit" type page that is Orange and a "color" type page that is Orange.

Please see this post for more info: [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Confluence-discussions/Tip-Discussion-Using-Unicode-icons-as-quot-page-type-quot/td-p/921361]

Page Types could be coupled with or related to templates.  For instance, I could create a new "Server" from a template.  Now that new page would be of type "server" and have it's own icon.

When you link to a page of a certain type it would show up with the icon, for example:
{quote}This application is hosted on 🖥 {color:#4c9aff}WIN-BG83081AC{color} and blah, blah, blah
{quote}
Types could be useful in reporting or filtering too.
fields.summary: Allow page "types"

fields.description:
h2. Introduction

There has been a passionate community of people in the Atlassian Community that has been [making a request|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Confluence-questions/Change-text-background-color-in-confluence-editor/qaq-p/304768?utm_source=atlcomm&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=kudos_answer&utm_content=topic] for this feature for 4 years now. Perhaps there is already a ticket in Jira here but obviously Atlassian seems to be out of touch with these individuals therefore I have opened a duplicate ticket. It would seem to me that this sort of feature could be whipped up in short order and appease community of individuals that are openly expressing their frustrations towards Atlassian.  What does it take to get the ear of Atlassian?
h2. User Story
{quote}As a user in the editor of a Confluence page
 I would like to have a control to set the background color of text
 So that I do not need to read 4 years of help support suggestions; try numerous hacks; and be forced to buy & install plugins to do a simple style change to my text
{quote}
h2. Acceptance Criteria
{quote}Given that a user is in the Confluence page edit mode
 And has selected some text

When clicking on a background color control in the palette 
 And choosing yellow

Then the background of the text just magically turns yellow
 And the user can burn up their 5x7 cheat sheet for setting the background color
{quote}
fields.summary: Add ability to change background color of text

h3. Summary
If a page contains a number of nested panel macros the PDF export for the space will hang at 50%, If exporting just the page with nested panel macros the page calculation will never complete. 

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page with a number of nested panel macros eg. [https://battlebeard.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/TEST/pages/57278483/Xero-Simplenumbers+integration+details]
# Export page to PDF

h3. Expected Results
Page export completes
h3. Actual Results
PDF export progress never proceeds beyond calculation, no error in logs just constant polling for task progress.
 !Capture2.JPG|thumbnail! 


h3. Notes

h3.Workaround
Remove all nested panel macros and re-design page.
Exclude pages with nested panel macro from space exports.
fields.summary: Nested panel macro prevents PDF export

Unable to copy/cut a row from a table as it highlighted the row once pasting it.

# Cut/Copy the row using the "copy row" button on the tool box

h3. Expected Results

Content from the row is pasted on the table and the user was able to edit the other row.

Clicking on the row keep highlighting the content from the copied row

fields.description:
{panel:title=Status Update 25 November 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ff7f7f|titleBGColor=#ff7f7f|bgColor=#e5e5e5}
Hello all,

After reviewing outstanding bugs in our system, we recognized that this bug has duplicated other bugs already created. We appreciate your feedback on the slowness you're experiencing, we'd like to categorize your behavior and follow our progress on the bugs linked:

 # Frozen page while trying to EDIT the page on the New Editor
 # Keyboard typing delays while tying to EDIT the page on the New Editor
 # Slowness in initial page LOAD or RENDER on the New Editor

These three categories are caused by different mechanisms. To help us better debug the what type of experience you're facing, we will be tracking 1 & 2 on this bug: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-70197. If you're experiencing 3, please follow this separate bug: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-70858

If you are instead experiencing issues with the edit performance on the Legacy Editor, please follow https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-70970

Best,

Sunny Xu
{panel}

Example: [https://hello.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/SECURITY/pages/319719945/ACTUAL+CRIMES+T-shirt+Sign+Up|https://hello.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/SECURITY/pages/319719945/ACTUAL+CRIMES+T-shirt+Sign+Up?src=mail&src.mail.timestamp=1539939036190&src.mail.notification=com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-notifications-batch-plugin%3Abatching-notification&src.mail.recipient=8a7f8085655c0f4a01657ae8399603f4&src.mail.action=view]

 

Writing text in a page with long content (e.g 500+ entries table) is laggy, because react is re-rendering the whole page on each keystroke. This also means that each new content added to the page progressively harms the overall performance.
fields.summary: Performance issues when content of page is too long
